objectives: Apply critical thinking to analyze education reform

multiple_intelligences.linguistic: Write a story or essay about education reform
multiple_intelligences.logical_mathematical: Analyze patterns and create logical arguments about education reform
multiple_intelligences.spatial: Create visual representations or mind maps of education reform
multiple_intelligences.bodily_kinesthetic: Role-play or act out scenarios related to education reform
multiple_intelligences.musical: Create a song or rhythm exercise about education reform
multiple_intelligences.interpersonal: Collaborate in groups to discuss education reform
multiple_intelligences.intrapersonal: Reflect individually on personal connection to education reform
multiple_intelligences.naturalistic: Categorize and classify concepts related to education reform

content.basic: Simplified texts and basic vocabulary about education reform
content.intermediate: Standard complexity materials with support about education reform
content.advanced: Complex authentic materials and academic texts about education reform

process.grouping: Individual, pairs, small groups, or whole class based on preference
process.choice: Multiple activity options aligned with learning style

differentiation.environment: Quiet study area with writing materials and references

warm_up.description: Students write quick responses about education reform
warm_up.materials: Paper and pens or digital writing tools

main_activities.description: Students receive information about education reform through reading_writing modality
Students practice language related to education reform using reading_writing approach
Students produce original content about education reform demonstrating intermediate thinking

discussion_prompts: How does education reform affect people?
What are the advantages and disadvantages of education reform?
How would you solve problems related to education reform?

vocabulary_support.tier_2: Academic and topic-specific words for education reform
vocabulary_support.tier_3: Domain-specific technical terms related to education reform

homework_options.required: Core assignment at intermediate level using reading_writing approach

teacher_notes.grouping_suggestions: Flexible grouping based on readiness and interest
teacher_notes.time_management: Build in flexibility for different pacing needs

common_difficulties: Students may lack background knowledge about education reform
Vocabulary may be challenging for some students
Some students may need more processing time
methodology: UDL + Differentiated Instruction + CLT + Multiple Intelligences
references: CAST Universal Design for Learning Guidelines
